text: Chris gonet develops solutions for smart
metering service providers that operate
in the electricity Industries in
Australia and New Zealand our primary
customer is in telehub we're in the
business of deploying smart electricity
meters and to do so they utilize
Technology Solutions which are designed
and developed by Chris Gannett when
you've got 500 odd thousand electricity
meters they each report back to base
with a file once a day that
traditionally comes in through some sort
of a processing head-in and then goes
into a relational database we wanted to
investigate serverless so some sort of
ingestion pipeline that comes in through
observerless way if you like and then
stored in S3 and then queryable and
basically looking at the options of how
could you build a serverless data lake
so we had an idea and we had no idea how
to do it and that's where the team
assigned to the data lab came in so what
we managed to do in the lab was design a
solution to solve a problem problem that
they knew they were about to face there
were changes in regulations to how much
data was going to be collected from
smart meters and and their existing
platform was not going to scale to to
manage that amount of data and so they
needed to really quickly design a
solution and prove that it would work
and so that's exactly what they did in
the lab we built out an architecture and
then they built alongside us a prototype
of that solution so that meant in a very
very defined time frame they were really
confident about a solution they could
take forward and meet the regulatory
requirements that were coming so so the
very first thing we wanted to do was to
develop a data big data analytics
capability we didn't have much prior
experience in in doing big data analysis
so we thought a data lab would be a good
way to get an introduction into the big
data analytics capabilities that exist
on the AWS platform nothing beats
um
experience and actually doing that for
yourself and the data lab program
provided the hands-on experience so that
we could
prove that the technologies that we
thought about or been suggested by the
AWS data lab team we're actually going
to deliver us the value that we need
they can introduce some more efficient
way to help us for example previously we
have maybe two steps to achieve our goal
but after AWS people have asked maybe we
can just use one step to achieve that so
it will reduce our cost and save our
time
when we talk about a lab we're talking
about usually a four-day intensive
Hands-On engagement where the customer
is building a solution but actually the
key to a really great lab is what
happens in the prep
and so we usually spend about four weeks
in a series of calls with the customer
to deeply understand the problem that
they have the business context the
current State architecture and what
they're hoping to achieve and we use
that information to design an
architecture that they then build in the
lab so what makes this program very
successful is having access to AWS
professionals that have deep expertise
in different domains such as AI ml data
Lake streaming those professionals are
working with Organization for a
different time period to help them very
quickly and rapidly build a prototype if
an organization was interested in the
data lab program if they felt that it
might be something that could help
accelerate and solve a business problem
I would encourage them to reach out to
their account manager to discuss the
nomination process
